br.uff.midiacom.ana.descriptor
Class NCLDescriptorSwitch<T extends NCLElement,Ed extends NCLDescriptor,Er extends NCLTestRule,El extends NCLLayoutDescriptor,R extends ExternalReferenceType,Eb extends NCLBindRule<T,Ed,Er,R>>

java.lang.Object
  br.uff.midiacom.ana.util.xml.XMLElementPrototype<T>

All Implemented Interfaces:
NCLLayoutDescriptor<T,El>, NCLElement<T>, NCLBindConstituent<T>, ReferredElement<T>, XMLElement<T>
public class NCLDescriptorSwitch<T extends NCLElement,Ed extends NCLDescriptor,Er extends NCLTestRule,El extends NCLLayoutDescriptor,R extends ExternalReferenceType,Eb extends NCLBindRule<T,Ed,Er,R>>
extends NCLIdentifiableElementPrototype<T>
implements NCLLayoutDescriptor<T,El>

Class that represents a descriptor switch element. A descriptor switch element represents a set of alternative descriptor to be used by a content node. The descriptor to be used is chosen during presentation, according to a set of rules.
This element defines the attributes:

  • id - id of the descriptor switch element. This attribute is required.

This element has as children the elements:
  • bindRule - element relating a rule to a descriptor switch component descriptor. The descriptor switch must have at least one bindRule element.
  • defaultDescriptor - element representing the descriptor switch component descriptor to be used when no rule is true. This element is optional.
  • descriptor - element representing a descriptor. The descriptor switch must have at least one descriptor element.

setDefaultDescriptor

public void setDefaultDescriptor(Ed defaultDescriptor)
                          throws XMLException
Sets the element representing the descriptor switch component descriptor to be used when no rule is true. This element is optional. Set the default descriptor to null to erase a default descriptor already defined.

Parameters:
defaultDescriptor - element representing a reference to a descriptor switch component descriptor or null to erase a default descriptor already defined.
Throws:
XMLException - if any error occur while creating the reference to the descriptor switch component descriptor.

Returns:
element representing a reference to a descriptor switch component descriptor or null if the attribute is not defined.
